answerText: : eosinophils or acidophils [10] Another substance that may be released by eosinophils is this molecule also produced by mast cells. Substances that prevent the release or action of this amino acid derivative are commonly used to treat allergic symptoms.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Chicago Culture Heroes and Psychopomps | 7 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: James Fisk [10] These white blood cells are stained red by a namesake dye and are triggered in allergic reactions and infections by parasitic worms. They produce major basic protein.
